definition: low/beneath/to lower (one's head)/to let droop/to hang down/to incline
vulgar style (used of items to be censored)

sentences.english: He has a good clean sense of humour.
sentences.chinese: 他有着高雅而不低俗的幽默感。

sentences.english: Not all of the humor on 4chan is this crass, however.
sentences.chinese: 但並非4chan上所有的幽默都這麼低俗。

sentences.english: What if Chinese fans serenade rival teams with the guttural, unprintable "Beijing curse"?
sentences.chinese: 如果中國球迷的拉拉隊發出低俗的“京罵”將會怎樣？

sentences.english: This thesis firstly introduces the manifestations of vulgarization of the mass media.
sentences.chinese: 本文首先介紹了大衆傳媒低俗化的表現方式。

sentences.english: His common sense would have dismissed that as repulsive and vulgar.
sentences.chinese: 他的常識本會以可憎和低俗爲由予以排斥這一思想的。

sentences.english: The vulgarization of TV drama is the combined effect of the entire circulation.
sentences.chinese: 電視劇低俗化是整個流通環節共同作用的結果。

sentences.english: Are the girls to blame for their ignorance and being unladylike?
sentences.chinese: 無知和低俗只怪她們嗎？

sentences.english: These days it’s very much a low caste tradition.
sentences.chinese: 那時，神之女奴已是一個非常低俗的傳統。

sentences.english: The vulgarization phenomena is existing in the body of Chinese culture.
sentences.chinese: 中華文化體系正存在着低俗化現象。

sentences.english: The novel is not vulgar language, speech and countenance rendering is not excessive.
sentences.chinese: 語言新穎不低俗，辭色渲染不過度。

sentences.english: However, many Christian leaders condemn the fact that it is being increasingly secularized and commercialized.
sentences.chinese: 但是，很多的基督教領袖指責這樣太過低俗和商業化。

sentences.english: The dit-mension of obscenity is that by which Christianity revives the religion of men.
sentences.chinese: 低俗的淋漓盡致，是基督教用來複活人的宗教的策略。

sentences.english: Beauty can be eye-pleasing or low.
sentences.chinese: 漂亮可以很養眼或者低俗。

sentences.english: Rough and sweet, fast and fragile, down and dirty.
sentences.chinese: 粗暴而甜蜜，迅速而脆弱，低俗而下流。

definition: sensationalism/vulgar claptrap to please the crowds/playing to the gallery/demagogy
to cater to the public's taste/kitsch/commercial
"sensational headline writers", people who write misleading titles in order to generate clicks from Internet users/clickbait
vulgar style (used of items to be censored)
